defaultCourse1.title: Introduction to Informatics
defaultCourse1.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course covers essential concepts of computer science, including algorithms, syntax and semantics, and efficiency, matching TUM's course objectives.

defaultCourse2.title: Fundamentals of Programming (Exercises & Laboratory)
defaultCourse2.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course covers programming in Java, mastering programming concepts, and fundamental concepts of informatics as taught in module IN0001, similar to TUM's course.

defaultCourse3.title: Introduction to Computer Organization and Technology - Computer Architecture
defaultCourse3.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course lacks depth in areas such as parallel systems and optimization compared to TUM's course.

defaultCourse4.title: Introduction to Software Engineering
defaultCourse4.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course adequately covers software engineering fundamentals, including project phases and design patterns, fitting TUM's course content.

defaultCourse5.title: Operating Systems and System Software
defaultCourse5.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course includes concurrency, resource management, and system security, corresponding well with TUM's course focus.

defaultCourse6.title: Fundamentals of Algorithms and Data Structures
defaultCourse6.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course covers data structures, algorithms, and efficiency comprehensively, aligning with TUM's course goals.

defaultCourse7.title: Fundamentals of Databases
defaultCourse7.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course includes essential concepts of relational databases and SQL, meeting the learning outcomes of TUM's course.

defaultCourse8.title: Computer Networking and IT Security
defaultCourse8.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course covers networking protocols and cryptography thoroughly, paralleling TUM's course content.

defaultCourse9.title: Information Theory and Theoretical Informatics
defaultCourse9.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course addresses formal languages, computability, and complexity theory effectively, fulfilling TUM's course competencies.

defaultCourse10.title: Introduction to Signal Processing
defaultCourse10.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course is missing aspects of signal processors and digital transform techniques compared to TUM's course.

defaultCourse11.title: Foundations of Cyber-Physical Systems
defaultCourse11.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course lacks coverage of modeling, analysis, and control aspects of cyber-physical systems as expected by TUM's course.

defaultCourse12.title: Enterprise Architecture Management and Reference Models
defaultCourse12.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course lacks content coverage regarding models, methods, and visualization tools in enterprise architecture which are fundamental to TUM's course.

defaultCourse13.title: Business Process Management
defaultCourse13.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course covers business processes, risk management, and the role of IT adequately, fitting the objectives of TUM's course.

defaultCourse14.title: Discrete Structures
defaultCourse14.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course covers propositional logic and graph theory but lacks depth in algebraic basics and advanced logical formalisms compared to TUM's course.

defaultCourse15.title: Linear Algebra
defaultCourse15.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course misses elements such as eigenvalue applications and complex number calculus compared to the breadth of TUM's course.

defaultCourse16.title: Calculus
defaultCourse16.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course lacks several advanced topics such as differential equations and multi-variable calculus techniques, which are part of TUM's curriculum.

defaultCourse17.title: Discrete Probability Theory
defaultCourse17.explanation_recommendation: The applicant's course effectively covers discrete probability concepts and estimation principles, aligning with TUM's course content.
